bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Eine Neuauflage des Buches “Der Buchevangelist”. Diese Zusammenstellung von Aussagen über Haus-zu-Haus Arbeit unterstreicht die Wichtigkeit des Verlagsdienstes, die Notwendigkeit, dass die Literatur in die Welt gebracht wird, sowie die Qualifikationen die in der Buchevangelisation gebraucht werden. Dieser Band ist ein ausgezeichnetes Handbuch für alle, die bei der Verteilung der Literatur beteiligt sind – ob als Vollzeitarbeiter oder als Laie.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Unter dem allgemeinen Titel “Heiligung” erschien in frühen Ausgaben des Review and Herold 1881 eine Serie von elf hilfreichen Artikeln aus der Feder von Ellen G. White. Im gleichen Jahrzehnt wurden die Artikel zusammengefasst und als Broschüre veröffentlicht. Im Jahr 1937 wurde unter dem bekannten Titel “The Sanctified Life” dieses gesamte Material mit einem zusätzlichen Absatz aus Propheten und Könige aufgelegt.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Dieses Buch besteht aus Briefen und anderen Ratschlägen, die Ellen G. White für Verliebte gab. Es ist voller tiefer Ratschläge für alle die an eine Heirat denken.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Die “größte jemals gehaltene Predigt” wurde auf einem damals namenlosen Berg gegeben, der jetzt als der “Berg der Seligpreisungen” bekannt ist. Die Worte die vor 2000 Jahren gesprochen wurden haben durch Jahrhunderte hindurch als Anleitung und Ermutigung für Christen auf dem Weg nach oben widergehallt. Selig sind die geistlich Armen, die Sanftmütigen, die Barmherzigen. Diese Segnungen bilden nur einen Teil der Botschaft, die Christus auf dem überfüllten Berghang gab. Diese Veröffentlichung gibt einen Einblick in die tiefen Botschaften der größten Predigt Christi und legt sie weiter aus.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: In diesem klassischen Andachtsbuch untersucht Ellen G. White die Tiefen der beliebtesten Lehren Jesu. Sie bietet ein tiefes geistliches Verständnis der Gleichnisse Christi, wie sie in unserem täglichen Leben Anwendung finden.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Tausende haben durch dieses kleine Buch Jesus kennengelernt. Der Weg zu Christus. Und es hat vielen geholfen, einschließlich jenen die mit ihm schon für Jahre gewandelt sind, ihn noch besser kennenzulernen.

bookEntries.title: Der bessere Weg zu einem neuen Leben 1995

img.alt: Der bessere Weg zu einem neuen Leben 1995

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: In diesem klassischen Andachtsbuch untersucht Ellen G. White die Tiefen der beliebtesten Lehren Jesu. Sie bietet ein tiefes geistliches Verständnis der Gleichnisse Christi, wie sie in unserem täglichen Leben Anwendung finden.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Als eine der ersten Kompilationen von Ellen Whites Schriften, wurde dieses Buch gemeinsam unter ihrer Aufsicht und sorgfältigen Prüfung zusammengestellt. Zuvor veröffentlichte und unveröffentlichte Texte zum Thema Gesundheit bilden das Fundament der christlichen Mäßigkeit und Bibelreinheit, mit Betonung auf ein einfaches, praktisches, gesundes Christentum. Weitere Themen sind die Ausbildung von Eltern, Einflüsse des Heimes, Ernährung und Mäßigkeit und unsere Pflichten im sozialen Zusammenleben. Indem jeder Aspekt des Lebens berührt wird, bietet dieses Buch die so notwendige Richtlinie für alle.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Eine neue Zusammenstellung für eine wichtige Botschaft

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Tägliche Lesungen - aus Briefen, Manuskripten und anderen Quellen von Ellen White - kommen zusammen um den Hintergrund, Absicht und Ungeheuerlichkeit des großen Kampfes zu illustrieren. Und wie der Titel verrät, erklärt jeder Abschnitt die Kraft Gottes den heftigen Konflikt trotz der bedrohlichen Umstände zu überwinden.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Gott hätte ungefallene Engel als seine Stellvertreter auf Erden auswählen können. Stattdessen hat er uns ausgewählt. “ Jeder wahre Jünger wird für das Reich Gottes geboren, um ein Missionar zu sein. Wer von dem lebendigen Wasser trinkt, wird selbst eine Quelle des Lebens” (Das Leben Jesu, 179).

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Dies ist eine überarbeitete und erweiterte Zusammenstellung aus den Schriften von Ellen G. White. Es ist ein hoch geschätztes Handbuch mit Ratschlägen und Anweisungen für Prediger und alle anderen Missionsarbeiter die mit der Siebenten-Tags-Adventisten Bewegung verbunden sind geworden.
bookInfo.publisher: Internationale Traktatgesellschaft Hamburg, Basel, Wien, Budapest, Den

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: “Das Gebet ist das Atmen der Seele. Es ist das Geheimnis der Kraft des Innenlebens.” Die Atmosphäre des Gebetes und der Hingabe während des Tages ist ein wichtiger Teil des geistlichen Lebens - besonders in den letzten Momenten der Geschichte der Erde. Diese Publikation bietet eine praktische Zusammenstellung von hilfreichen Aussagen um unser Gebetsleben und unsere Gemeinschaft mit unserem Herrn zu bereichern und zu vertiefen.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: In diesen letzten Tagen der Erdgeschichte werden diejenigen, die sich um die medizinischen Bedürfnisse anderer kümmern, auch eine offene Tür für deren geistlichen Bedürfnisse finden. Christus selbst “ging umher und tat Gutes und heilte alle, die vom Teufel geplagt waren.” Seine Heilung war nicht nur körperlich, sondern auch geistlich.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Dieser Band ist eine umfassende Auswahl von Ellen G. White 's veröffentlichten Schriften aus den 1850er Jahren, zusammen mit einem Vorwort das den historischen Hintergrund des Textes erklärt. Der autobiographische Teil des Buches beschreibt die Bekehrungserfahrung der Autorin, die Miller-Bewegung von 1840-1844, und die ersten Visionen, die die Grundlage ihrer Theologie und ihres Dienstes bildeten. Ein zweiter Abschnitt enthält Ratschläge bei verschiedenen Angelegenheiten die die Erfahrung der frühen Adventisten Gläubigen betreffen.
bookInfo.publisher: Pacific Press Publishing Association Brookfield, Illinois

bookEntries.title: Erfahrungen und Gesichte sowie Geistliche Gaben

img.alt: Erfahrungen und Gesichte sowie Geistliche Gaben

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Obwohl die Bibel die Engel als Boten Gottes beschreibt die seinen Willen auf Erden ausführen, wimmelt es von Missverständnissen in Bezug auf ihre Natur und Rolle in menschlichen Angelegenheiten. Ellen G. White hob oft den Schleier zwischen der sichtbaren und unsichtbaren Welt und legte die Wahrheit über Engel und ihrer Beteiligung an den Ereignissen auf Erden dar indem sie beschrieb, was Gott ihr im Geist zeigte. Beginnend mit Luzifers Rebellion im Himmel bis zum Werk der Engel nach Beendigung der Sünde bietet dieser Band einen Einblick hinter die Kulissen von der Existenz und Aktivität von Engel, wie sie dem Werk des Himmels nachgehen. Und das beste von allem ist, dass es ihnen helfen wird sich der Gemeinschaft der Engel in ihrem täglichen Gang mit Gott zu erfreuen.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Was bedeutet eine wahre Bekehrung? Und wir kann ich in der Gnade “zum vollen Maß der Fülle Christi” wachsen? Ein neues Leben das sich auf Erweckung und Reformation konzentriert beantwortet Fragen über dieses Thema. Der Text ist aus verschiedenen Artikeln entnommen und als kleines Handbuch zusammengestellt.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Dieses klassische Werk zum Thema Erziehung legt die einzigartige und herausfordernde Idee dar, dass “das Werk der Erziehung und das Werk der Erlösung im höchsten Sinne eins sind”. Das letztendliche Ziel allen Lernens sollte sein, mehr über unseren Schöpfer und Erlöser zu verstehen und dieses Verständnis in unserem persönlichen Leben zu reflektieren. In ihren Schriften zu diesem Thema, hat Ellen White nicht so sehr an die Details des Lehrplans oder Bildungssystems gedacht, sondern mehr an die großen, leitenden Grundsätze. Das Ergebnis ist ein durchdringender Blick auf die Faktoren, die die wahre Erziehung im ihrem weitesten Sinne ausmachen. Der Leser wird auf diesen Seiten Einblicke finden, die nicht nur Eltern, Schülern und Lehrer leiten, sondern alle, die wahre Bildung in der großen Schule des Lebens suchen.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Dieses klassische Werk zum Thema Erziehung legt die einzigartige und herausfordernde Idee dar, dass “das Werk der Erziehung und das Werk der Erlösung im höchsten Sinne eins sind”. Das letztendliche Ziel allen Lernens sollte sein, mehr über unseren Schöpfer und Erlöser zu verstehen und dieses Verständnis in unserem persönlichen Leben zu reflektieren. In ihren Schriften zu diesem Thema, hat Ellen White nicht so sehr an die Details des Lehrplans oder Bildungssystems gedacht, sondern mehr an die großen, leitenden Grundsätze. Das Ergebnis ist ein durchdringender Blick auf die Faktoren, die die wahre Erziehung im ihrem weitesten Sinne ausmachen. Der Leser wird auf diesen Seiten Einblicke finden, die nicht nur Eltern, Schülern und Lehrer leiten, sondern alle, die wahre Bildung in der großen Schule des Lebens suchen.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Viele Dinge tragen zu einer guten Gesundheit bei: Fröhlichkeit, frische Luft, Bewegung, Ernährung und positive Beziehungen zu anderen Menschen, um nur einige zu nennen. Entscheidend ist auch eine persönliche Beziehung mit dem Schöpfer, der uns das Leben und alles was wir brauchen um gesund und glücklich zu sein geschenkt hat. In diesem Buch beschäftigt sich Ellen White mit der Krankheit der Seele und dem heilenden Balsam den man findet indem man in allem Gott vertraut. In einfacher und schöner Sprache geschrieben, will dich “In den Fußspuren des großen Arztes” zu einem Leben voller Freude und Wonne führen – einem Leben in Verbindung mit der Quelle der Heilkraft.
bookInfo.publisher: Advent-Verlag Hamburg, Basel, Wien, Budapest, Den Haag

bookEntries.title: In den Fußspuren des großen Arztes

img.alt: In den Fußspuren des großen Arztes

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Während ihres 70-jährigen Dienstes schrieb Ellen G. White mehr als 5.000 Artikel mit einer Vielzahl von Themen.

bookEntries.title: Frühe Schriften von Ellen G. White

img.alt: Frühe Schriften von Ellen G. White

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Diese Zusammenstellung enthält praktische Ratschläge für christliche Familien, einschließlich von Richtlinien wo das Heim stehen sollte, wie man es freundlich gestaltet, sowie Ratschläge für ein funktionierendes Zusammenleben.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Band 5 der “Conflict of the Ages”-Serie führt die Geschichte der Auseinandersetzung zwischen Gott und Satan zu seinem letzten und glorreichen Abschluss. Beginnend mit der Zerstörung Jerusalems und fortgesetzt durch die Christenverfolgungen im römischen Reich, dem Abfall im dunklen Mittelalter, das strahlende Licht der Reformation und die weltweite religiöse Erweckung des neunzehnten Jahrhunderts, skizziert dieser Band den Konflikt in der Zukunft bis zur Wiederkunft Jesu und die Herrlichkeiten der neu geschaffenen Erde. So wie das Ende immer näher rückt, wird die bedeutende Frage der Treue zu Gott entscheidend. In diesem abschließenden Band weist die Autorin kraftvoll auf die Grundsätze, die den drohenden Konflikt betreffen hin, und wie jeder Mensch für Gott und seine Wahrheit feststehen kann.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: “Das Gebet ist das Atmen der Seele. Es ist das Geheimnis der Kraft des Innenlebens.” Die Atmosphäre des Gebetes und der Hingabe während des Tages ist ein wichtiger Teil des geistlichen Lebens - besonders in den letzten Momenten der Geschichte der Erde. Diese Publikation bietet eine praktische Zusammenstellung von hilfreichen Aussagen um unser Gebetsleben und unsere Gemeinschaft mit unserem Herrn zu bereichern und zu vertiefen.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Die erstaunliche Geschichte der frühchristlichen Gläubigen wird in diesem vierten Band der “Conflict of the Ages”-Serie erzählt. Nachdem Jesus Satan besiegt hatte und in den Himmel zurückkehrte, wandte der Feind seine Aufmerksamkeit auf die Gemeinde Christi auf Erden. Hier sind spannende Geschichten von wilden Verfolgungen und unbeugsamer Treue zu Gott. Petrus, Paulus, Jakobus, Johannes, Lukas, Barnabas, Stephanus, Markus und die anderen frühen Apostel trugen die wunderbare Botschaft des Evangeliums in die ganze damals bekannte Welt. Nicht bereit, ihren Glauben aufzugeben, gaben viele ihr Leben. Diese Geschichte setzt sich gegenwärtig fort. Christi Gemeinde heute tut das gleiche Werk und hat die gleiche Verheißung göttlicher Führung und Macht.
bookInfo.publisher: Advent-Verlag Zürich; Top Life — Wegweiser Verlag GmbH, Wien

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Das Heil ist allein durch den Glauben, aber der Glaube ist nie allein.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Diese Ausgabe besteht aus einem Brief der von Ellen White bezüglich dem Werk und seiner Wichtigkeit in Europa geschrieben wurde. Diese Botschaft ist für uns heute genauso gültig wie zu ihrer Zeit.

bookEntries.title: Hier in Europa muss ein großes Werk getan werden

img.alt: Hier in Europa muss ein großes Werk getan werden

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: “Zu den schönsten Aufgaben, die jemand übernehmen kann, gehört die intellektuelle Betreuung eines anderen Menschen”, erklärt die Autorin. Dadurch wird die Wichtigkeit und der Adel der uns von Gott gegebenen Aufgabe als zusammenarbeitende Mitarbeiter ausgedrückt. Diese Sammlung von inspirierten Schriften beschäftigt sich mit einem breiten Spektrum von Themen wie der Platz der wahren Psychologie in der Evangeliumsarbeit, sowie die Gefahren der weit verbreiteten Fälschung. Die Ratschläge beinhalten auch Themen wir Erziehung, die Wichtigkeit häuslicher Einflüsse sowie die Wissenschaft die hinter dem geistigen Wachstum und der Ausbildung steht.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: “Zu den schönsten Aufgaben, die jemand übernehmen kann, gehört die intellektuelle Betreuung eines anderen Menschen”, erklärt die Autorin. bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: “Die Leiden Christi”

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Das Leben Jesu (Band 3 “Conflict of the Ages”-Serie) ist der Ellen White-Klassiker über das Leben von Jesus - der Eine, der in der Mitte der ganzen Menschheitsgeschichte steht. Niemand sonst hatte einen so starken Einfluss auf den Planet Erde als Jesus Christus. In diesem Buch stellt die Autorin die Ereignisse des Lebens Jesu nicht in streng chronologischer Reihenfolge dar, sondern sie stellt Ihn als den Einen dar, der die tiefsten Sehnsüchte des menschlichen Herzens erfüllen kann. Sie präsentiert die göttliche Schönheit des Lebens des Erlösers und die Liebe Gottes die sich in seinem Sohn offenbart. Neues und herrliches Licht blitzt aus vielen bekannten Passagen der heiligen Schrift. Folgen sie Jesus auf diesen Seiten von seiner Geburt in Bethlehems Stall bis zu seinem Tod am Kreuz, seine glorreiche Auferstehung und triumphale Rückkehr in den Himmel.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Die Vorteile des Landlebens wurden wiederholt durch die Ratschläge des Geistes der Weissagung betont. Im Laufe der Jahre wurden tausende von Siebenten-Tags-Adventisten bei der Wahl der häuslichen Umgebung und in ihren Beziehungen zu öffentlichen Organisationen durch die vielfach publizierten Ratschläge der Zeugnisse geleitet. Da die Vorzeichen der bevorstehenden Krise die subtilen Gefahren und den rasende Konflikt vor uns zeigen, ist dieser Rat wiederveröffentlicht, um die Aufmerksamkeit eines jeden Gemeindegliedes zu bekommen. Präsentiert mit diesen Aussagen werden die detaillierteren Anweisungen von Zeit zu Zeit in Publikationen oder Briefen der Unterweisung gedruckt.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Holen sie sich einen persönlichen Einblick in das Leben der Botschafterin Gottes in “Leben und Wirken” von Ellen White. Auf diesen Seiten erzählt Ellen White in ihren eigenen Worten einen kurzen Bericht über ihre Kindheit und ihre frühen christlichen Erfahrungen in Verbindung mit der großen zweiten Adventbewegung von 1840 bis 1844. Sie erinnert sich lebhaft an die Leiden und Freuden des jugendlichen Dienstes in den Jahren nach der großen Enttäuschung. Sie beschreibt die Kämpfe und Erfolge welche die kleine Schar ernster Seelen begleiteten, die schließlich zur Gemeinschaft der Siebenten-Tags-Adventisten wurde. Sie fährt fort, von der umfassenderen Arbeit von sich und ihren Mann ab ihrer Ehe bis zu seinem Tod im Jahre 1881 zu erzählen.

bookEntries.title: Leben und Wirken von Ellen G. White

img.alt: Leben und Wirken von Ellen G. White

bookEntries.title: Mit dem Evangelium von Haus zu Haus

img.alt: Mit dem Evangelium von Haus zu Haus

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Propheten und Könige, der zweite Band der “Conflict of the Ages”-Serie, beginnt mit der Geschichte der glorreichen Regierung Salomos über Israel und endet mit dem Exil und der Gefangenschaft der Nation. Er zeichnet die Geschichte eines begünstigten und auserwählten Volkes, das zwischen Treue zu Gott und den Göttern der umliegenden Nationen schwankt. Auf diesen Seiten können die dramatischen Zeugnisse des tobenden Kampfes zwischen Gott und Satan um der Herzen von Männern und Frauen lebhaft gesehen werden. Hier findet der Leser faszinierende Charaktere - der weise Salomon, der furchtlose Elija, der böse Ahas, der geliebte Daniel, der mutige Jeremia und viele andere. Ihre Erfahrungen bieten reiche Lehren des Glaubens und Beweise der Liebe und Fürsorge Gottes.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Patriarchen und Propheten ist der erste Band in der “Conflict of the Ages”-Serie. Er deckt das umfassende Panorama der Menschheitsgeschichte von der Erschaffung der Erde bis zur Regierung des isrealitischen Königs David ab. Mit ungewöhnlichen Einblicken beschreibt die Autorin die Rolle unseres Planeten in dem kosmischen Konflikt zwischen Recht und Unrecht, Wahrheit und Irrtum. Sie beschreibt die tragische Rebellion, der vor vielen Tausenden von Jahren im Himmel stattgefunden hat, und macht klar, dass dieser andauernde Konflikt zwischen Satan und Gott jeden Menschen der auf der Erde lebt beeinflusst. Patriarchen und Propheten zeigt, wie sich dieser Konflikt im Leben von Männern und Frauen im Alten Testament auswirkte. Dieses Buch beantwortet Fragen wie: Wo kommen wir her? Wohin gehen wir? Wenn Gott allmächtig ist, warum verhindert er nicht die Ausbreitung des Bösen und seine tragischen Folgen?

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Mehrere Generationen von Jugendlichen wurden durch diesen kompromisslosen Ruf zur Pflicht, Reinheit und Dienst erfüllt. Die Autorin, die ihren Dienst mit nur 17 Jahren begann, lädt die Jugendlichen ein, ihre Lektüren, Kleidung, Musik, und das gesellschaftliche Zusammenleben zu prüfen und wertlose Vergnügungen die den geistlichen Fortschritt bremsen zu verwerfen. Sie untersucht die grundlegenden Charakterzüge, die den Erfolg oder Misserfolg im geistlichen Leben ausmachen und diskutiert praktische Themen wie das Heim und Eltern, Gesundheit, Freundschaft und Ehe und wie man wahre Liebe erkennt.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Eine Stunde. Das ist die ganze Zeit, die ein Sabbatschulleiter hat, um einen bleibenden Eindruck im Geist von Menschen zu hinterlassen, die viele Stunden weltlicher Indoktrination durch die Medien jede Woche ausgesetzt sind. Das Ziel dieses Buches ist es, das Beste aus dieser Stunde zu manchen.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Diese Serie enthält etwa ein Drittel des Inhaltes der Zeugnisse und zeigen die wesentlichen Ratschläge für das Weltfeld ohne das Thema zu wiederholen, welches zwangsläufig in den ersten neun Bänden der Zeugnisse über einen Zeitraum von 55 Jahren ausgestellt wurde. Die Artikel in ihrer natürlichen chronologischen Ordnung präsentieren die Ratschläge in einer übersichtlichen Weise.

bookEntries.title: Aus der Schatzkammer der Zeugnisse — Band 1

img.alt: Aus der Schatzkammer der Zeugnisse — Band 1

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Diese Serie enthält etwa ein Drittel des Inhaltes der Zeugnisse und zeigen die wesentlichen Ratschläge für das Weltfeld ohne das Thema zu wiederholen, welches zwangsläufig in den ersten neun Bänden der Zeugnisse über einen Zeitraum von 55 Jahren ausgestellt wurde. Die Artikel in ihrer natürlichen chronologischen Ordnung präsentieren die Ratschläge in einer übersichtlichen Weise.

bookEntries.title: Aus der Schatzkammer der Zeugnisse — Band 2

img.alt: Aus der Schatzkammer der Zeugnisse — Band 2

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Diese Serie enthält etwa ein Drittel des Inhaltes der Zeugnisse und zeigen die wesentlichen Ratschläge für das Weltfeld ohne das Thema zu wiederholen, welches zwangsläufig in den ersten neun Bänden der Zeugnisse über einen Zeitraum von 55 Jahren ausgestellt wurde. Die Artikel in ihrer natürlichen chronologischen Ordnung präsentieren die Ratschläge in einer übersichtlichen Weise.

bookEntries.title: Aus der Schatzkammer der Zeugnisse — Band 3

img.alt: Aus der Schatzkammer der Zeugnisse — Band 3

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Viele Dinge tragen zu einer guten Gesundheit bei: Fröhlichkeit, frische Luft, Bewegung, Ernährung und positive Beziehungen zu anderen Menschen, um nur einige zu nennen. Entscheidend ist auch eine persönliche Beziehung mit dem Schöpfer, der uns das Leben und alles was wir brauchen um gesund und glücklich zu sein geschenkt hat. In diesem Buch beschäftigt sich Ellen White mit der Krankheit der Seele und dem heilenden Balsam den man findet indem man in allem Gott vertraut. In einfacher und schöner Sprache geschrieben, will dich “In den Fußspuren des großen Arztes” zu einem Leben voller Freude und Wonne führen – einem Leben in Verbindung mit der Quelle der Heilkraft.

bookEntries.title: Auf den Spuren des großen Arztes

img.alt: Auf den Spuren des großen Arztes

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Diese Auswahl von Ellen White's Artikeln bezüglich Sabbatschularbeiter sind chronologisch geordnet und werden mit Auszügen von den Zeugnissen ergänzt. Für fast jeden Aspekt der Sabbatschularbeit ist ein Ratschlag gegeben wie Anleitung zu didaktischen Methoden sowie die Festlegung der praktischen und charakterlichen Qualifikationen von Lehrkräften und ihren Helfern.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Mäßigkeit war ein beliebtes Thema von Ellen G. White sowohl in ihren Schriften als auch in ihren öffentlichen Reden. Im Laufe der Jahre mahnte sie alle, ob jung oder alt, Mäßigkeit zu praktizieren und energisch zu fördern. Obwohl die Gesellschaft sich seit Sr. White lebte und schrieb stark veränderte, bleiben die Grundsätze die sie in Bezug auf Mäßigkeit betonte in unserem gegenwärtigen Leben äußerst aktuell. Die Macht von Alkohol und andere Formen der Unmäßigkeit um Gesundheit, Moral und geistliches Wahrnehmungsvermögen zu zerstören ist heute noch vorhanden. Die ausgewählten Abschnitte in diesem Buch wurden aus dem gesamten Bereich ihrer Schriften zu diesem Thema, einschließlich von Quellen die längst vergriffen, sind genommen.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Diese kurze Veröffentlichung konzentriert sich auf den großen Auftrag, den Christus seinen Jüngern gegeben hat: hinzugehen und alle Nationen zu lehren. Was ist unser Werk als seine Kinder? Und wie können wir wirksam das Evangelium der Welt bringen?

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Die erstaunliche Geschichte der frühchristlichen Gläubigen wird in diesem vierten Band der “Conflict of the Ages”-Serie erzählt. Nachdem Jesus Satan besiegt hatte und in den Himmel zurückkehrte, wandte der Feind seine Aufmerksamkeit auf die Gemeinde Christi auf Erden. Hier sind spannende Geschichten von wilden Verfolgungen und unbeugsamer Treue zu Gott. Petrus, Paulus, Jakobus, Johannes, Lukas, Barnabas, Stephanus, Markus und die anderen frühen Apostel trugen die wunderbare Botschaft des Evangeliums in die ganze damals bekannte Welt. Nicht bereit, ihren Glauben aufzugeben, gaben viele ihr Leben. Diese Geschichte setzt sich gegenwärtig fort. Christi Gemeinde heute tut das gleiche Werk und hat die gleiche Verheißung göttlicher Führung und Macht.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Das Werk Christi im himmlischen Heiligtum ist eine Schlüsselwahrheit unserer Zeit—die besonders seit der großen Enttäuschung 1844 ins Blickfeld gerückt wurde. Dieses kleine Buch beschreibt im einzelnen die Wichtigkeit der Prophetie, die gegenwärtige Tätigkeit und die praktische Anwendung des Heiligtumsdienstes.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Die Verheißung des Heiligen Geistes wurde durch alle Generationen des Volkes Gottes seit der Zeit der Apostel gehegt und gepflegt. In diesem täglichen Andachtsbuch legt Ellen White die Bedeutung dieses “wichtigsten Geschenkes” aus, die Wirkung seiner Gegenwart in unserem Leben, und was wir tun können um mit Ihm zusammenzuarbeiten.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Tausende haben durch dieses kleine Buch Jesus kennengelernt. Der Weg zu Christus. Und es hat vielen geholfen, einschließlich jenen die mit ihm schon für Jahre gewandelt sind, ihn noch besser kennenzulernen.

bookEntries.title: Gute Nachricht Für Alle - Das Evangelium Durchdringt Das Römische Reich

img.alt: Gute Nachricht Für Alle - Das Evangelium Durchdringt Das Römische Reich

bookEntries.title: Wie Alles Begann Von Der Schöpfung Bis Zum König David

img.alt: Wie Alles Begann Von Der Schöpfung Bis Zum König David

bookEntries.title: Vom Schatten Zum Licht - Der Grosse Kampf Zwischen Gut Und Böse

img.alt: Vom Schatten Zum Licht - Der Grosse Kampf Zwischen Gut Und Böse

bookEntries.title: Der Sieg Der Liebe - Das Leben Von Jesus Christus

img.alt: Der Sieg Der Liebe - Das Leben Von Jesus Christus

bookEntries.title: Macht Und Ohnmacht - Das Geteilte Israel Und Die Grosse Verheissung

img.alt: Macht Und Ohnmacht - Das Geteilte Israel Und Die Grosse Verheissung

bookInfo.description: Die Luther Übersetzung ist eine der bekanntesten Versionen, die auch viele spätere Bibel Übersetzungen in verschiedenen Sprachen einschließlich der Englischen stark beeinflusste. Mit dem Ziel, das einfache Volk Deutschlands zu erreichen, wurde der Text dem gewöhnlichen Gebrauch angepasst. Gleichzeitig beeinflusste sie damit auch die deutsche Sprache in vielerlei Hinsicht. Seit dem Originaldruck vor nahezu fünfhundert Jahren wurde die Luther Bibel überarbeitet und aktualisiert um auch weiterhin die Menschen zu erreichen.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.publisher: Maranatha Hellenic Publications University Boulevard Berrien Springs

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.publisher: HELLENIC PUBLICATIONS 8785 University Boulevard Berrien Springs, Ml 49

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.publisher: Maranatha Hellenic Publications Berrien Springs, Michigan.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.publisher: Maranatha Hellenic Publications, Berrien Springs Michigan

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The amazing story of the early Christian believers is told in Volume 4, The Acts of the Apostles. After Jesus was victorious over Satan and returned to heaven, the enemy turned his attention to Jesus' church on earth. Here are thrilling stories of fierce persecutions and unswerving loyalty to God. Peter, Paul, James, John, Luke, Barnabas, Stephen, Mark, and the other early apostles carried the wonderful news of the gospel to all of the then-known world. Unwilling to surrender their faith, many gave their lives. That story is still continuing. Christ's church today is carrying forward the same work and has the same promise of divine guidance and power.
bookInfo.publisher: Mountain View, CA: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: This compilation contains practical counsel for Christian families, including guidance on where to locate the home and how to make it pleasant, and counsel on how to get along with other family members.
bookInfo.publisher: Hagerstown, MD: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: This book was the first Ellen G. White writing in the field of health after the vision of June 6, 1863. It depicts the perils of secret vice. It was reprinted by James White in 1870 in the book, A Solemn Appeal Relative to Solitary Vice and the Abuses and Excesses of the Marriage Relation. It is also paralleled in the Testimonies, and was drawn from heavily for Child Guidance in the section “Preserving Moral Integrity.”
bookInfo.publisher: Battle Creek, MI: Seventh-day Adventist Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: An Appeal to the Youth is a collection of letters written by Ellen White to her children, prior to the death of her eldest son, Henry, at the age of 16. These letters are an excerpt from the complete publication, which originally included Uriah Smith's address at Henry White's funeral, as well as text from other authors
bookInfo.publisher: Battle Creek, MI: Seventh-day Adventist Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: In these last days of earth’s history, those who meet the medical needs of others will have the door opened to meet spiritual needs as well. Christ Himself “went about doing good, healing all who were oppressed by the devil.” His healing was not only physical, but spiritual as well.

bookEntries.title: A Call to Medical Evangelism and Health Education

img.alt: A Call to Medical Evangelism and Health Education

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The original source material for modern English book—A Call to Stand Apart.
bookInfo.publisher: Hagerstown, MD: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Child Guidance covers the essentials of parenting, with chapters on specific building blocks of character, such as purity, cheerfulness, self-control, reverence, respect, honesty, cleanliness, and courtesy. It includes guidance on how to teach self-denial, how to mold the will, reinforce good habits, evoke penitence without resentment, and conduct effective family worships.
bookInfo.publisher: Washington, D.C.: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The sanctuary in heaven is the very center of Christ's work in behalf of men. It concerns every soul living upon the earth. It opens to view the plan of redemption, bringing us down to the very close of time and revealing the triumphant issue of the contest between righteousness and sin. It is of the utmost importance that all should thoroughly investigate these subjects and be able to give an answer to everyone that asketh them a reason of the hope that is in them.—Ellen G. White

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The articles included in this book are presented without abridgement and are arranged chronologically. Most of the articles do not appear in other published volumes.
bookInfo.publisher: Battle Creek, MI: International Tract Society

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: This book is a personal narrative of Ellen G. White’s early life, highlighting some of her more important visions.
bookInfo.publisher: Mountain View, CA: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookEntries.title: Christian Experience and Teachings of Ellen G. White

img.alt: Christian Experience and Teachings of Ellen G. White

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: This compilation of statements regarding organization and co-working within the church was originally produced as a handbook for gospel workers. The counsel contained gives insight and guidance for the work of both ministers and laymen. Practical topics touch on issues such as management and business practices, cooperation among the brethren, and the important foundation of personal piety.
bookInfo.publisher: Washington, D.C.: Ellen G. White Estate

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: God might have chosen unfallen angels as His representatives on earth. Instead he chose us. “Every true disciple is born into the kingdom of God as a missionary. He who drinks of the living water becomes a fountain of life” (The Desire of Ages, 195).
bookInfo.publisher: Hagerstown, MD: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: One of the earliest compilations of Ellen White's writings, this book was put together under her supervision and careful examination. Previously-published and unpublished texts on the topic of health form the foundation of Christian Temperance and Bible Hygiene, with emphasis on simple, practical, healthful Christianity. Themes include parental training, home influences, diet and temperance, and our duty in social relationships. Touching every aspect of life, this book gives much-needed guidance for all.
bookInfo.publisher: Battle Creek, MI: Good Health Publishing Co.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: In this devotional classic, Ellen G. White explores the depths of the best-loved teachings of Jesus, offering a deeply spiritual understanding of the parables of Christ as they apply to the life today.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Children's Story on the Life of Jesus

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: This compilation of statements regarding the canvassing work highlights the importance of the publishing ministry, the need for the literature to be carried to the world, and the qualifications needed in colporteur evangelism. The content of this publication was reprinted in the book Colporteur Ministry, and provides an excellent handbook for anyone involved in the distribution of literature—whether full-time or as a layperson.
bookInfo.publisher: Mountain View, CA: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Essentially a reprint of The Colporteur Evangelist, this compilation of statements regarding the canvassing work highlights the importance of the publishing ministry, the need for the literature to be carried to the world, and the qualifications needed in colporteur evangelism. This volume is an excellent handbook for anyone involved in the distribution of literature—whether full-time or as a layperson.
bookInfo.publisher: Mountain View, CA: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Jesus, the Creator, was once put to the test in a lonely desert by Satan, His most cunning creature. The fate of the world hung in the balance. Emaciated by 40 days of fasting, He faced the most enticing sophistries of the great deceiver and met each seductive argument with Scripture: “It is written.”
bookInfo.publisher: Washington, D. C.: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Counsels for the Church is a comprehensive selection of inspired materials from Ellen White that first appeared in books and periodicals during her lifetime. Grouped into sixty-six chapters, this counsel and instruction covers a wide range of topics. Because of space limitations, the compilers selected only the most essential and practical counsels on themes of significance and practical value to both the church and the individual. They are designed to draw Christians closer to God, giving them deeper insights into how to live daily in His love and grace.
bookInfo.publisher: Nampa, ID: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Decades before many physiologists were concerned with the close relationship between diet and health, Ellen G. White in her writings clearly pointed out the connection between the food we eat and our physical and spiritual welfare. In her discourses and writings from 1863 onward, she discussed frequently the importance of diet and adequate nutrition.
bookInfo.publisher: Washington, D.C.: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Throughout her ministry Ellen White devoted much effort and thought to alleviating the sorrows of the sick and suffering and to pointing them to the Great Physician who is able to heal to the uttermost—both physically and spiritually.
bookInfo.publisher: Mountain View, CA: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: An hour. That’s all the time a Sabbath school leader has to make a lasting impression on minds exposed to many hours of secular indoctrination by the media each week. To help make the most of that hour is the purpose of this book.
bookInfo.publisher: Washington, D.C.: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Stewardship is properly managing the resources that God has committed to our care.
bookInfo.publisher: Washington, D.C.: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: In this book, counsel is given on conducting a school, with special attention to subject matter, discipline, and objectives to be emphasized.
bookInfo.publisher: Mountain View, CA: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookEntries.title: Counsels to Parents, Teachers, and Students

img.alt: Counsels to Parents, Teachers, and Students

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Counsels to Writers and Educators gives inspired counsel on the principles of Christian book and periodical editing, as well as other factors in the production of gospel literature.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The advantages of country living have been repeatedly stressed through the Spirit of prophecy counsels. Through the years thousands of Seventh-day Adventists have been guided in the choice of home environments and in their relationships to organizations of the world by the widely published testimony counsels on these vital points. As the omens of the impending crisis indicate the subtlety of the perils and the fury of the conflict before us, this counsel is republished to engage the attention of every church member. Presented with these statements are the more detailed instruction printed from time to time in publications or letters of counsel.
bookInfo.publisher: Washington, D.C.: Review and Herald Publishing Associatio

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: As the crises in the world become greater and more frequent, people are left with questions. Why do sin and suffering exist? What's still to come? How can we face the trials and catastrophes? And how can we be truly victorious in this life?
bookInfo.publisher: Nampa, ID: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: “Lord, how shall I best serve and glorify Thy name in the earth? How shall I conduct my life to make Thy name a praise in the earth, and lead others to love, serve, and honor Thee? Let me only desire and choose Thy will. Let the words and example of my Redeemer be the light and strength of my heart. While I follow and trust in Him, He will not leave me to perish. He shall be my crown of rejoicing.”– Review and Herald, Aug. 10, 1886
bookInfo.publisher: Hagerstown, MD: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The Desire of Ages (Volume 3 of the Conflict of the Ages series) is Ellen White’s classic on the life of Jesus—the One who stands at the center of all human history. No one else has had such a profound influence on Planet Earth as Jesus Christ. In this book the author does not set forth the events of Jesus’ life in strict chronological order, but she presents Him as the One who can satisfy the deepest yearnings of the human heart. She presents the divine beauty of the life of the Savior, the love of God as revealed in His Son. New and glorious light flashes from many familiar passages of Scripture. Follow Jesus in these pages from His birth in Bethlehem’s stable to His death on the cross, His glorious resurrection, and triumphant return to heaven.
bookInfo.publisher: Mountain View, CA: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: This volume is a comprehensive selection of Ellen G. White’s published writings from the 1850s, along with a prologue explaining the historical background of the text. The autobiographical section of the book describes the author’s conversion experience, the Millerite movement of 1840-1844, and the early visions that formed the foundation of her theology and ministry. A second section contains counsel on various matters pertaining the experience of the early Adventist believers.
bookInfo.publisher: Washington, D.C.: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: This classic work on education sets forth the unique and challenging idea that “the work of education and the work of redemption are one.” The ultimate goal of all learning should be to understand more about our Creator-Redeemer and to reflect that understanding in our personal lives. In her writings on this subject, Ellen White was concerned, not with details of curriculum or educational systems, but with great, guiding principles. The result is a penetrating look at the factors that make up true education in its broadest sense. The reader will find in these pages insights to guide not only parents, students, and teachers, but all who seek true education in the great school of life.
bookInfo.publisher: Mountain View, CA: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Focusing on the time from creation until the last days of King David, this condensed version of Patriarchs and Prophets delves into the origins of the great controversy between God and Satan, chronicles the battle as it transferred to Earth, and illustrates how God's faithful people have fought the good fight of faith through the ages. As the first of a five-part series, From Eternity Past describes the historical foundation for what we see in our world today and gives principles on how to take a stand for truth even in our day. And in it all, we see that “God is Love.”

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Presenting God’s last warning message to a doomed world is the “highest, greatest work” ever given to human beings. This comprehensive handbook on evangelism shows how appropriate strategies and personal preparation of both head and heart empower the Christian to lead people to accept Christ and prepare for His soon return.
bookInfo.publisher: Washington, D.C.: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Salvation is by faith alone, but faith is never alone.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Compiled from various other works, these complete and unabridged articles give detailed counsel on the topic of education, while also providing the full context of each statement. From the Biblical method of schooling, to home training, to the work and qualifications of teachers, this publication gives thorough guidance for anyone working with children or in the educational field.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: A compilation of Ellen G. White statments about Seventh-day Adventist's being part of God's remnant people led by Him until the end of time.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: This is a revised and enlarged compilation from the writings of Ellen G. White. It has become a highly prized handbook of counsel and instruction to ministers and to all other missionary workers connected with the Seventh-day Adventist movement.
bookInfo.publisher: Battle Creek, MI: Review and Herald Publishing Co.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: This is a revised and enlarged compilation from the writings of Ellen G. White. It has become a highly prized handbook of counsel and instruction to ministers and to all other missionary workers connected with the Seventh-day Adventist movement.
bookInfo.publisher: Washington, D.C.: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Volume 5 of the Conflict of the Ages series carries the story of the controversy between God and Satan to its ultimate and glorious conclusion. Beginning with the destruction of Jerusalem and continuing through the persecutions of Christians in the Roman Empire, the apostasy of the Dark Ages, the shining light of the Reformation, and the worldwide religious awakening of the nineteenth century, this volume traces the conflict into the future, to the Second Coming of Jesus and the glories of the earth made new. As the end draws ever closer, the vital issue of loyalty to God will become decisive. In this concluding volume, the author powerfully points out the principles involved in the impending conflict and how each person can stand firmly for God and His truth.
bookInfo.publisher: Mountain View, CA: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Volume 5 of the Conflict of the Ages series carries the story of the controversy between God and Satan to its ultimate and glorious conclusion. Beginning with the destruction of Jerusalem and continuing through the persecutions of Christians in the Roman Empire, the apostasy of the Dark Ages, the shining light of the Reformation, and the worldwide religious awakening of the nineteenth century, this volume traces the conflict into the future, to the Second Coming of Jesus and the glories of the earth made new. As the end draws ever closer, the vital issue of loyalty to God will become decisive. In this concluding volume, the author powerfully points out the principles involved in the impending conflict and how each person can stand firmly for God and His truth.
bookInfo.publisher: Mountain View, CA: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: As you go through life, you may sense that the world is gripped in a conflict between good and evil. From what you see in the news it may look as if evil is winning. Headlines describe famine, wars, unemployment, pollution, and disease. The media can tell you what is happening, but this book reveals why. The Great Hope also tells you what will happen next. This glimpse into the future is based on a source that has never failed in its prophecies—the Bible. The conflict between good and evil is coming to a dramatic climax that will affect every family on the planet. But take hope. You can choose to be on the winning side.
bookInfo.publisher: Review and Herald Publishing Association, Hagerstown, MD

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: This publication was compiled to form a comprehensive collection of Ellen White's statements regarding food production and distribution as part of the evangelistic work. Emphasis is placed on the use of the health food work as a way to win souls. The included counsels give encouragement—as well as warnings against dangers and misconceptions in the work—in order to ensure that this part of the right arm work remains in the right relation to the body of Christ.
bookInfo.publisher: Washington, D.C.: Ellen G. White Publications

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Compiled from the writings of Ellen G. White by Dr. David Paulson, Healthful Living sets forth in topically-arranged excerpts, “in the most concise and condensed form possible the various teachings upon the subjects of health, health reform and allied matters which are to be found in the writing of Mrs. E. G. White.”
bookInfo.publisher: Battle Creek, MI: Medical Missionary Board

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Some of Ellen White’s earliest visions contained bright glimpses of heaven and the earth made new. When she came out of vision, this world seemed dark and lonely compared with the brilliant beauty of the world to come which she had seen so vividly. And she often struggled to find the words to describe what she had been shown in vision.
bookInfo.publisher: Nampa, ID: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The life of Jesus, His methods of teaching and working, His great sacrifice and love for fallen humanity. These are the themes which all of heaven delights to contemplate, and which bring the greatest joy to God's children. In lively language, and with deep lessons for our lives today, From Heaven With Love (a condensed version of The Desire of Ages) brings the reader face to face with their Saviour—the Lord of heaven, who became one of us for our redemption.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: A practical guide to everyday blessings.
bookInfo.publisher: Nampa, ID: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The love and character of God has been put in question since the fall of Lucifer, who has spent millennia warring against the Lord and His faithful subjects. In this condensed version of The Great Controversy, the conflict is shown in the history of the first martyrs, the persecution of the Dark Ages, the subtle attacks in our “enlightened time,” and through prophetic views of the great final battle. Scripture declares that God's people will be victorious “by the blood of the Lamb, and by the word of their testimony; and they loved not their lives unto the death.” In their every act, word, and thought, they will express their faith and assurance that “God is Love.”

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The E. G. White portion of this book includes her “Notes of Travel,” tracing her journey from California to Europe and her account of the first of her three visits to many of the European countries, drawn largely from her reports published in The Review and Herald. Also contained are thirteen “Practical Addresses,” given at the councils attended in September, 1885, and three concluding chapters presenting an “Appeal for Our Missions.”

bookEntries.title: Historical Sketches of the Foreign Missions of the Seventh-day Adventists

img.alt: Historical Sketches of the Foreign Missions of the Seventh-day Adventists

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: This booklet is a collection of 8 crucial chaptes from the book: The Great Controversy. It covers the entrance of sin into the universe, answering in a clear, convincing manner many of the questions that have puzzled the minds of men in all ages. Its author, Ellen G. White, deals with the unseen forces of good and evil that constantly battle for the mastery of every human being's soul.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: A new look for an important message:
bookInfo.publisher: Boise, ID: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: This book consists of letters and other counsel which Mrs. White gave to couples in love. It is full of thoughtful advice for all contemplating marriage.
bookInfo.publisher: Mountain View, CA: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: This publication includes chapters written by Ellen White regarding her early life and work. The autobiographical portion chronicles the progress of the Advent movement in the 1840s and 1850s. These pages are part of a larger book containing text from other authors.
bookInfo.publisher: Battle Creek, MI: Seventh-day Adventist Publishing Association

bookEntries.title: Life Sketches of James White and Ellen G. White (1880 ed.)

img.alt: Life Sketches of James White and Ellen G. White (1880 ed.)

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: This publication includes chapters written by Ellen White regarding her early life and work. The autobiographical portion chronicles the progress of the Advent movement in the 1840s and 1850s. These pages are part of a larger book containing text from other authors.
bookInfo.publisher: Battle Creek, MI: Seventh-day Adventist Publishing Association

bookEntries.title: Life Sketches of James White and Ellen G. White (1888 ed.)

img.alt: Life Sketches of James White and Ellen G. White (1888 ed.)

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Get a more personal glimpse into the life of God's messenger in Life Sketches of Ellen White. In these pages Ellen White recounts, in her own words, a brief account of her childhood days, and her early Christian experience in connection with the great second advent movement of 1840 to 1844. She vividly recalls the sorrows and joys of youthful ministry in the years following the Great Disappointment. She pictures the struggles and successes that attended the efforts of the small band of earnest souls who built up the work that would eventually become the Seventh-day Adventist Church. She goes on to tell of the extended labors of herself and her husband from their marriage until his death in 1881.
bookInfo.publisher: Mountain View, CA: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookEntries.title: Life Sketches of Ellen G. White

img.alt: Life Sketches of Ellen G. White

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The first of Mrs. White's compilations on the colporteur work, Manual for Canvassers touches on topics such as the importance of the publishing work, the qualifications of the workers, and practical guidance in the carrying out of literature distribution. This publication's material was reprinted in both Colporteur Evangelist and Colporteur Ministry.
bookInfo.publisher: Mountain View, CA: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Ellen White wrote a great deal about health. Much of her counsel in this book is directed to medical workers, but people not directly involved in health-care work also will find much of interest and value. The author placed great importance on obedience to God's law as a foundation for good health. She believed that disregarding God's moral law leads to disregard for His physical laws that govern the health of body and mind. This comprehensive view of health—one that involves body, mind, and spirit—is set forth in this book.
bookInfo.publisher: Mountain View, CA: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Several generations of youth have been nourished by this uncompromising call to duty, purity, and service. The author, who began her ministry when only 17 years of age, invites youth to examine their reading, dress, music, and social life, and discard cheap amusements that retard spiritual progress. She examines those fundamental traits of character that make for success or failure in the spiritual life, and discusses practical subjects such as home and parents, health, courtship and marriage, and how to recognize true love.
bookInfo.publisher: Hagerstown, MD: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Volume 1: This collection of inspired writings deals with a wide spectrum of topics including the place of true psychology in the gospel work, as well as the dangers of its popular counterfeit. “To deal with minds is the nicest work in which men ever engaged,” the author states. By this is expressed the importance and nobility of our God-given task as co-workers together.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Volume 2: What is the true psychology in the gospel work, as well as the dangers of its popular counterfeit? This and other important wide-ranging topics are covered in this volume. Counsels on education, the importance of home influences, as well as the science behind mental growth and cultivation is provided.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Many things contribute to good health—cheerfulness, fresh air, exercise, diet, and positive relationships with other people, to name a few. Crucial also is a personal relationship with the Creator who gave us life and everything we need for health and happiness. In this book Ellen White deals with sickness of the soul and the healing balm to be found by trusting God for all things. Written in simple, beautiful language, Ministry of Healing will point you to a life full of joy and gladness—a life in touch with the Source of healing power.
bookInfo.publisher: Mountain View, CA: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: This volume is a call to action—a plea for believers to work for their Savior by bringing the gospel to the millions of people in the cities of the world. Topics include the challenges of ministering in the city, strategies, methods, selecting and training workers, and lessons from Scripture.
bookInfo.publisher: Review and Herald Publishing Association, Hagerstown, MD

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: What does true conversion mean? And how can I continue growing in grace “unto the measure of the stature of the fullness of Christ”? A New Life focuses on the revival and reformation process, answering questions about the theme. The text is drawn from various articles, and compiled into a small handbook.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: From the rich treasury of Ellen White's writings, the compilers of this book have brought together a selection of inspired counsels that apply most directly to the life and work of the local church pastor. Members of the General Conference Ministerial Association in conjunction with The White Estate are pleased to make this compilation available. Here the local pastor will find instruction on the work of ministry, relationships, evangelism and church growth, lay training, worship and special services, pastoral care and nurture, organization and administration. An invaluable resource for every Adventist pastor.
bookInfo.publisher: Silver Spring, MD: General Conference Ministerial Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Patriarchs and Prophets is the first volume in the Conflict of the Ages series. It covers the sweeping panorama of human history from the creation of Earth to the reign of Israel's King David. With unusual insights, the author describes the role of our planet in the cosmic conflict between right and wrong, truth and error. She describes the tragic rebellion that took place in heaven many thousands of years ago and makes plain that this ongoing conflict between Satan and God affects each person who lives on Earth. Patriarchs and Prophets shows how this conflict worked itself out in the lives of men and women in Old Testament times. It answers such questions as, Where did we come from? Where are we going? If God is all-powerful, why doesn’t He prevent the spread of evil and its tragic results?
bookInfo.publisher: Washington, D.C.: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The book of Second Peter contains invaluable counsel for both young and old. In this collection of Ellen White's sermons on Second Peter, special emphasis is placed on child education, school work, and practical godliness in parenting and family life.
bookInfo.publisher: Washington, D.C.: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: “Prayer is the breath of the soul. It is the secret of spiritual power.” The atmosphere of prayer and devotion throughout the day is an important part of spiritual life—especially in these last moments of Earth's history. This publication provides a practical collection of helpful statements to enrich and deepen our prayer life and communion with our Lord.
bookInfo.publisher: Nampa, ID: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Prophets and Kings, the second volume in the Conflict of the Ages series, opens with the story of Solomon’s glorious reign over Israel and ends with the nation’s exile and captivity. It traces the history of a favored and chosen people, vacillating between allegiance to God and to the gods of the nations around them. In these pages can vividly be seen dramatic evidences of the raging struggle between God and Satan for the hearts of men and women. Here the reader will find fascinating characters—wise Solomon, fearless Elijah, wicked Ahaz, beloved Daniel, courageous Jeremiah, and many others. Their experiences provide rich lessons of faith and evidences of God’s love and providential care.
bookInfo.publisher: Mountain View, CA: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: In regard to the publishing work, Ellen White wrote, “Let everyone professing the name of Christ act a part in sending forth the message, or ‘The end of all things is at hand’; or ‘prepare to meet thy God.’” She added that the gospel publications “should go everywhere.” In The Publishing Ministry, Mrs. White not only stresses the importance of the literature work in these last days, but she also gives counsel in regard to leadership, co-working, distribution, content, and every other aspect related to the publication of God's message to the world.
bookInfo.publisher: Hagerstown, MD: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: In this volume Ellen White offers many inspired and inspiring answers to questions raised by golden-agers. These gems of thought have been gleaned from her letters, manuscripts, books, and periodical articles, many of which were written after she was 65–the 23 years from 1892-1915.
bookInfo.publisher: Hagerstown, MD: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Under the general title of “Sanctification” there appeared in the early issues of The Review and Herald for 1881 a series of eleven helpful articles from the pen of Ellen G. White. In the same decade the eleven articles were drawn together and published as a pamphlet. In 1937 under the familiar title of The Sanctified Life, this material was again reissued in its entirety with the addition of one paragraph from Prophets and Kings to make the present volume.
bookInfo.publisher: Washington, D.C.: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: During her 70 years of ministry Ellen G. White wrote more than 5,000 articles on a wide variety of subjects. The unique collection in this book includes important statements on inspiration, her work as messenger of the Lord, and the processes by which God communicates His will to the human family. It also includes fresh insights on Christian experience, soul wining, and the struggle between the forces of righteousness and the forces of evil for the allegiance of God's people. Of special value are messages presenting Christ in the central truths of the Advent message, and those that offer practical instruction, warnings, and counsel for the church.
bookInfo.publisher: Washington, D.C.: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: During her 70 years of ministry Ellen G. White wrote more than 5,000 articles on a wide variety of subjects. The unique collection in this book includes important statements on inspiration, her work as messenger of the Lord, and the processes by which God communicates His will to the human family. It also includes fresh insights on Christian experience, soul wining, and the struggle between the forces of righteousness and the forces of evil for the allegiance of God's people. Of special value are messages presenting Christ in the central truths of the Advent message, and those that offer practical instruction, warnings, and counsel for the church.
bookInfo.publisher: Washington, D.C.: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: During her 70 years of ministry Ellen G. White wrote more than 5,000 articles on a wide variety of subjects. The unique collection in this book includes important statements on inspiration, her work as messenger of the Lord, and the processes by which God communicates His will to the human family. It also includes fresh insights on Christian experience, soul wining, and the struggle between the forces of righteousness and the forces of evil for the allegiance of God's people. Of special value are messages presenting Christ in the central truths of the Advent message, and those that offer practical instruction, warnings, and counsel for the church.
bookInfo.publisher: Washington, D.C.: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Published by James White, in 1851, this publication embodies a brief autobiographical sketch and visions given to Ellen White, many of which appeared earlier in various periodicals. This text was later reprinted and included in Early Writings.

bookEntries.title: A Sketch of the Christian Experience and Views of Ellen G. White

img.alt: A Sketch of the Christian Experience and Views of Ellen G. White

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: A brief Appendix to the title: Experience and Views. Where Ellen White clarfies several points she made in the book. It's now included as a Supplement in Early Writings

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: This publication presents an explanation of some misunderstood phrases in Experience and Views and certain further counsels, some of which had appeared in The Review and Herald. Reprinted in 1882 with Experience and Views and included in Early Writings.

bookEntries.title: Supplement to the Christian Experience and Views of Ellen G. White

img.alt: Supplement to the Christian Experience and Views of Ellen G. White

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: This book is a much-loved work of 32 chapters, devoted to the life and teachings of the apostle Paul. Later, it was replaced by The Acts of the Apostles (1911), which also deals with the experience of the other apostles. This was in harmony with the larger planning for the five volumes of the Conflict of the Ages series, where it fills the gap between The Desire of Ages and The Great Controversy.
bookInfo.publisher: Battle Creek, MI: Review and Herald

bookEntries.title: Sketches from the Life of Paul

img.alt: Sketches from the Life of Paul

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: This publication includes seven chapters of the original multi-author publication, A Solemn Appeal Relative to Solitary Vice and Abuses and Excesses of the Marriage Relation, compiled by James White. These portions of text by Ellen White are also presented—even more comprehensively —in The Adventist Home, Section V, and Child Guidance, Section XVI.
bookInfo.publisher: Battle Creek, MI: Seventh-day Adventist Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: In answer to Ellen White’s historic 1891 testimony her son James Edson White began evangelistic and educational work among Southern Blacks, using a missionary boat that plied the Mississippi River. Ellen White produced an ongoing series of testimonies on this subject, which Edson gathered up and published in 1898 and 1901. This reprint of that work, with the inclusion of additional material, reminds us that we are all brothers and sisters in Christ, and one in the Spirit.
bookInfo.publisher: Washington, D.C.: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Special Testimonies on Education brings together many previously unpublished letters and manuscripts written to parents, teachers, and school workers. Counsel is given on every facet of child guidance—from practical work and academics, to character growth and spirituality. As this publication proves, education entails much more than just a classroom lesson.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The gift of prophecy, bestowed on God's faithful throughout history, most recently rested upon Ellen White, who conveyed the given messages in admonition and writing. Many of her earliest testimonies and views are published in the Spiritual Gifts volumes.
bookInfo.publisher: Battle Creek, MI: Seventh-day Adventist Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The gift of prophecy, bestowed on God's faithful throughout history, most recently rested upon Ellen White, who conveyed the given messages in admonition and writing. Many of her earliest testimonies and views are published in the Spiritual Gifts volumes.
bookInfo.publisher: Battle Creek, MI: Seventh-day Adventist Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The gift of prophecy, bestowed on God's faithful throughout history, most recently rested upon Ellen White, who conveyed the given messages in admonition and writing. Many of her earliest testimonies and views are published in the Spiritual Gifts volumes.
bookInfo.publisher: Battle Creek, MI: Seventh-day Adventist Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The gift of prophecy, bestowed on God's faithful throughout history, most recently rested upon Ellen White, who conveyed the messages given her in admonition and writing. Many of her earliest testimonies and views are published in the Spiritual Gifts volumes.
bookInfo.publisher: Battle Creek, MI: Seventh-day Adventist Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The gift of prophecy, bestowed on God's faithful throughout history, most recently rested upon Ellen White, who conveyed the given messages in admonition and writing. Many of her earliest testimonies and views are published in the Spiritual Gifts volumes.
bookInfo.publisher: Battle Creek, MI: Seventh-day Adventist Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The Spirit of Prophecy, volumes 1-4, was the second publication of what is now known as the Conflict of the Ages series, vividly detailing the great controversy between God and Satan from beginning to end. In this first volume, the beginning of the war in heaven is described, and narration continues until the time of Solomon's reign.
bookInfo.publisher: Battle Creek, MI: Seventh-day Adventist Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The Spirit of Prophecy, volumes 1-4, was the second publication of what is now known as the Conflict of the Ages series, vividly detailing the great controversy between God and Satan from beginning to end. The second volume tells the wonderful story of Jesus and His life here on Earth. His great sacrifice and love for our race are shown in bright contrast to the dim shadows of life which we know in this world.
bookInfo.publisher: Battle Creek, MI: Seventh-day Adventist Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The Spirit of Prophecy, volumes 1-4, was the second publication of what is now known as the Conflict of the Ages series, vividly detailing the great controversy between God and Satan from beginning to end. After Christ's ascension, His followers took the gospel to every known corner of the world. This third volume of the series chronicles both the difficulties and triumphs of the apostolic church.
bookInfo.publisher: Battle Creek, MI: Seventh-day Adventist Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The Spirit of Prophecy, volumes 1-4, was the second publication of what is now known as the Conflict of the Ages series, vividly detailing the great controversy between God and Satan from beginning to end.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: As part of the Conflict of the Ages series, Prophets and Kings stands out in its narration of both the ups and downs of God's people. From Israel's greatness under Solomon's reign, to her downfall during the Babylonian captivity, and the subsequent history up to the time of Christ, God always had His faithful few who stood for truth in every circumstance. From Splendor to Shadow is a condensed version of these fascinating experiences, and details the lives of so many godly men and women who have gone before us.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Thousands have become acquainted with Jesus through this little book, Steps to Christ. And it has helped many more, including those who have walked with Him for years, to know Him better.
bookInfo.publisher: Mountain View, CA: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: An “adaptation” of materials prepared for The Desire of Ages as they came from the pen of Ellen G. White, presenting the high points of the story of Jesus in a vocabulary suitable for children.

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: In the mid-nineteenth century Ellen White experienced a series of visions concerning “the great controversy of the ages between Christ and Satan.” These visions inspired a small work entitled Spiritual Gifts, which was later expanded into a four-volume work, The Spirit of Prophecy. Later this material was further amplified and published in the five-volume Conflict of the Ages series.
bookInfo.publisher: Hagerstown, MD: Review and Herald Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: Temperance was a favorite theme of Ellen G. White, both in her writings and in her public speaking. Through the years, she urged everyone, both young and old, to practice temperance and to promote it vigorously. Although society has changed markedly since Mrs. White lived and wrote, the principles she stressed regarding temperance remain remarkably relevant to contemporary life. The power of alcohol and other forms of intemperance to destroy health, moral fiber, and spiritual discernment is still present today. The selections appearing in this book have been drawn from the whole range of her writings on the topic, including sources long out of print.
bookInfo.publisher: Mountain View, CA: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The nine volume-set of counsels from the Spirit of Prophecy contain spiritual commentary of a general nature, along with many letters of intimate instruction to members of the church during Ellen White’s time.
bookInfo.publisher: Mountain View, CA: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The nine volume-set of counsels from the Spirit of Prophecy contain spiritual commentary of a general nature, along with many letters of intimate instruction to members of the church during Ellen White’s time.
bookInfo.publisher: Mountain View, CA: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.author: Ellen Gould White
bookInfo.description: The nine volume-set of counsels from the Spirit of Prophecy contain spiritual commentary of a general nature, along with many letters of intimate instruction to members of the church during Ellen White’s time.
bookInfo.publisher: Mountain View, CA: Pacific Press Publishing Association

bookInfo.publisher: Mountain View, CA: Pacific Press Publishing Association
